intro: Mallotus hookerianus var. papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan mallot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
